speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: SCENE V. Pentapolis. A room in the palace.

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Enter SIMONIDES, reading a letter, at one door: the Knights meet him

speaker: First Knight
text_entry: Good morrow to the good Simonides.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Knights, from my daughter this I let you know,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: That for this twelvemonth she'll not undertake

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: A married life.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Her reason to herself is only known,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Which yet from her by no means can I get.

speaker: Second Knight
text_entry: May we not get access to her, my lord?

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: 'Faith, by no means; she has so strictly tied

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Her to her chamber, that 'tis impossible.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: One twelve moons more she'll wear Diana's livery;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: This by the eye of Cynthia hath she vow'd

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And on her virgin honour will not break it.

speaker: Third Knight
text_entry: Loath to bid farewell, we take our leaves.

speaker: Third Knight
text_entry: Exeunt Knights

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: So,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: They are well dispatch'd; now to my daughter's letter:

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: She tells me here, she'd wed the stranger knight,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Or never more to view nor day nor light.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: 'Tis well, mistress; your choice agrees with mine;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: I like that well: nay, how absolute she's in't,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Not minding whether I dislike or no!

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Well, I do commend her choice;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And will no longer have it be delay'd.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Soft! here he comes: I must dissemble it.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Enter PERICLES

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: All fortune to the good Simonides!

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: To you as much, sir! I am beholding to you

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: For your sweet music this last night: I do

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Protest my ears were never better fed

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: With such delightful pleasing harmony.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: It is your grace's pleasure to commend;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Not my desert.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Sir, you are music's master.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The worst of all her scholars, my good lord.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Let me ask you one thing:

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: What do you think of my daughter, sir?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A most virtuous princess.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And she is fair too, is she not?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: As a fair day in summer, wondrous fair.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Sir, my daughter thinks very well of you;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Ay, so well, that you must be her master,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And she will be your scholar: therefore look to it.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I am unworthy for her schoolmaster.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: She thinks not so; peruse this writing else.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: [Aside]  What's here?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A letter, that she loves the knight of Tyre!

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: 'Tis the king's subtlety to have my life.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: O, seek not to entrap me, gracious lord,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A stranger and distressed gentleman,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That never aim'd so high to love your daughter,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: But bent all offices to honour her.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Thou hast bewitch'd my daughter, and thou art

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: A villain.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: By the gods, I have not:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Never did thought of mine levy offence;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Nor never did my actions yet commence

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A deed might gain her love or your displeasure.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Traitor, thou liest.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Traitor!

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Ay, traitor.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Even in his throat--unless it be the king--

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That calls me traitor, I return the lie.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: [Aside]  Now, by the gods, I do applaud his courage.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: My actions are as noble as my thoughts,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That never relish'd of a base descent.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I came unto your court for honour's cause,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And not to be a rebel to her state;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And he that otherwise accounts of me,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This sword shall prove he's honour's enemy.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: No?

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Here comes my daughter, she can witness it.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Enter THAISA

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Then, as you are as virtuous as fair,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Resolve your angry father, if my tongue

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Did ere solicit, or my hand subscribe

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To any syllable that made love to you.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Why, sir, say if you had,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Who takes offence at that would make me glad?

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Yea, mistress, are you so peremptory?

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: I am glad on't with all my heart.--

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: I'll tame you; I'll bring you in subjection.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Will you, not having my consent,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Bestow your love and your affections

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Upon a stranger?

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: who, for aught I know,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: May be, nor can I think the contrary,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: As great in blood as I myself.--

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Therefore hear you, mistress; either frame

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Your will to mine,--and you, sir, hear you,

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Either be ruled by me, or I will make you--

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Man and wife:

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Nay, come, your hands and lips must seal it too:

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And being join'd, I'll thus your hopes destroy;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And for a further grief,--God give you joy!--

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: What, are you both pleased?

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Yes, if you love me, sir.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Even as my life, or blood that fosters it.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: What, are you both agreed?

speaker: BOTH
text_entry: Yes, if it please your majesty.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: It pleaseth me so well, that I will see you wed;

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: And then with what haste you can get you to bed.

speaker: SIMONIDES
text_entry: Exeunt
